alert.note: Alert for Borden; Crane; Ector; Glasscock; Howard; Martin; Midland; Mitchell; Pecos; Reagan; Scurry; Upton; Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor; Ward (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 27 at 2:43PM CST until February 27 at 7:00PM CST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 15% OR LESS, 20-FT WINDS OF 20 MPH OR MORE, AND HIGH TO EXTREME FIRE DANGER FOR SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO AND MOST OF WEST TEXAS... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT TUESDAY AFTERNOON FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 10% OR LESS, 20-FT WINDS OF 20 MPH OR MORE, AND HIGH TO EXTREME FIRE DANGER FOR THE NORTHWEST PERMIAN BASIN AND SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO SOUTH TO THE DAVIS MOUNTAINS... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 15% OR LESS, 20-FT WINDS OF 20 MPH OR MORE, AND HIGH TO EXTREME FIRE DANGER FOR SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO AND MOST OF WEST TEXAS... * TIMING...Through this evening. * WINDS...West 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 9 percent. * RFTI...5 or critical. * IMPACTS...Avoid the use of open flames or any activities that may generate sparks. Accidental ignitions may have the potential to grow into dangerous wind-driven wildfires. Ensure that chains attached to trailers will not touch the pavement, thereby eliminating the possibility to generate sparks.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity and warm temperatures will increase potential for fire growth.

area.areaDesc: Borden; Crane; Ector; Glasscock; Howard; Martin; Midland; Mitchell; Pecos; Reagan; Scurry; Upton; Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor; Ward
